info.title: Syncro
info.description:
Welcome to the official Syncro API Docs.

To use these docs, you will need an active Syncro account. You can sign up for one here: [Syncro](https://syncromsp.com)

If you already have an active account, fill in your subdomain below and then click "Authorize" and fill in your api-key. The key is specific to your user account so it is found on the your user profile page.

Please review the [API License Agreement](https://syncromsp.com/syncromsp-api-license-agreement/) before using our API. By accessing our API, you are agreeing to the API License Agreement.

Please note there is a rate limit of 180 requests per minute per IP address on API Usage.

get.summary: Returns a paginated list of Appointments
get.description: Required permission: Appointments - View All (see-own never restricted)

parameters.name: date_from
parameters.description: Returns Appointments that start after the date. Example "2019-01-25"

parameters.name: date_to
parameters.description: Returns Appointments that start before the date. Example "2019-12-31"

parameters.name: mine
parameters.description: Return only current user's appointments

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Returns provided page of results, each 'page' contains 25 results

appointment.description:

Walkin Customer

Customer Information:

  Phone: 123 - walkin@somedomain.com

get.summary: Returns a paginated list of customers
get.description:
Required permission: Customers - List/Search
Single-Customer Users can only access own customer (self).

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: A customer field to order by. Examples "firstname ASC", "city DESC".

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search query

parameters.name: firstname
parameters.description: Any customers with a first name like the parameter

parameters.name: lastname
parameters.description: Any customers with a last name like the parameter

parameters.name: business_name
parameters.description: Any customers with a business name like the parameter

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Any customers with ID included in the list

parameters.name: not_id
parameters.description: Any customers with ID not included in the list

parameters.name: include_disabled
parameters.description: Whether or not the returned list of customers includes disabled customers

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Returns provided page of results, each 'page' contains 25 results

message: Email Only able to parse up to "it is not an email"

parameters.description: Length of time to mute alert for. Accepted values: '1-hour', '1-day', '2-days', '1-week', '2-weeks', '1-month', 'forever'

get.summary: Search all the things
get.description:
Additional permissions required depending on search results type:
- Customer, Contact, Asset: "Customers - List/Search"
- Lead: Leads - List/Search
- Invoice: Invoices - List/Search
- Estimate: Estimates - List/Search
- Ticket: Tickets - List/Search
- Product: Products - List/Search
- Purchase Order, Vendor: Purchase Orders - List/Search
- Report: Reports - View
- Wiki: Documentation - Allow Usage

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search query

get.summary: Returns a list of Account Settings
Returns Tabs Settings
Returns Printing Settings
Returns a paginated list of Ticket Timers

parameters.name: created_at_lt
parameters.description: Returns Ticket Timers created before the date. Example "2019-01-22"

parameters.name: created_at_gt
parameters.description: Returns Ticket Timers created after the date. Example "2019-12-22"

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Returns provided page of results, each 'page' contains 25 results

get.summary: Returns a paginated list of Tickets
get.description:
Required permission: Tickets - List/Search
Single-Customer Users can only access own tickets.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: Any Ticket with customer_id equal to the parameter.

parameters.name: contact_id
parameters.description: Any Ticket with contact_id equal to the parameter.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: Any Ticket with number equal to the parameter.

parameters.name: resolved_after
parameters.description: Returns Tickets resolved after the date. Example "2019-01-23".

parameters.name: created_after
parameters.description: Returns Tickets created after the date. Example "2019-02-25".

parameters.name: since_updated_at
parameters.description: Returns Tickets updated after the date. Example "2019-02-25".

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Any Ticket with status equal to the parameter. Examples "New", "In Progress", "Resolved", "Invoiced", "Waiting for Parts", "Waiting on Customer", "Scheduled", "Customer Reply", "Not Closed".

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search query

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: Any Ticket assigned to a User ID

parameters.name: mine
parameters.description: Any Ticket assigned to the current user

parameters.name: ticket_search_id
parameters.description: Returns results of a Ticket Search

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Returns provided page of results, each 'page' contains 25 results

post.description:
Required permission: Tickets - Create
Single-Customer Users can only access own tickets.

get.summary: Returns a paginated list of Timelogs
get.description:
Users with permission "Timelogs - Manage" may see timelogs for any/all users.
Otherwise, results scoped to current user.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: Returns Timelogs that belong to a User

put.summary: Updates a Timelog
put.description:
Users with permission "Timelogs - Manage" may see timelogs for any/all users.
Otherwise, results scoped to current user.

get.summary: Returns last Timelog
get.description:
Users with permission "Timelogs - Manage" may see timelogs for any/all users.
Otherwise, results scoped to current user.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: Returns Timelogs that belong to a User. The default is current user ID.

post.summary: Authorize a User with One Time Password

requestBody.description: Time-based one-time password from your authentication application.

example.instructions: Save the session token somewhere safe and send that with the api_key for all future web requests. It goes in a header called Authorization2FAToken.
Your multi-factor authentication attempt failed for the 6th time, please open Syncro in browser and recover MFA.
